Sentencas: The generation of direct current electricity using solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) involves several interplaying transport phenomena.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Their simulation is crucial for the design and optimization of reliable and competitive equipment, and for the eventual market deployment of this technology.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An open-source library for the computational modeling of mass-transport phenomena in SOFCs is presented in this article.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It includes several multicomponent mass-transport models (i.e. Fickian, Stefan-Maxwell and Dusty Gas Model), which can be applied both within porous media and in porosity-free domains, and several diffusivity models for gases.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The library has been developed for its use with OpenFOAM (R), a widespread open-source code for fluid and continuum mechanics.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The library can be used to model any fluid flow configuration involving multicomponent transport phenomena and it is validated in this paper against the analytical solution of one-dimensional test cases.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition, it is applied for the simulation of a real SOFC and further validated using experimental data.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: C++ Computer: Any x86 (the instructions reported in the paper consider only the 64 bit case for the sake of simplicity)
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Operating system: Generic Linux (the instructions reported in the paper consider only the open-source Ubuntu distribution for the sake of simplicity)
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Classification: 12 External routines: OpenFOAM (R) (version 1.6-ext) (http://www.extend-project.de) Nature of problem: This software provides a library of models for the simulation of the steady state mass and momentum transport in a multi-species gas mixture, possibly in a porous medium.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The software is particularly designed to be used as the mass-transport library for the modeling of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: When supplemented with other sub-models, such as thermal and charge-transport ones, it allows the prediction of the cell polarization curve and hence the cell performance.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Solution method: Standard finite volume method (FVM) is used for solving all the conservation equations.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The pressure-velocity coupling is solved using the SIMPLE algorithm (possibly adding a porous drag term if required).
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The mass transport can be calculated using different alternative models, namely Fick, Maxwell-Stefan or dusty gas model.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The code adopts a segregated method to solve the resulting linear system of equations.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The different regions of the SOFC, namely gas channels, electrodes and electrolyte, are solved independently, and coupled through boundary conditions.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Restrictions: When extremely large species fluxes are considered, current implementation of the Neumann and Robin boundary conditions do not avoid negative values of molar and/or mass fractions, which finally end up with numerical instability.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However this never happened in the documented runs.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Eventually these boundary conditions could be reformulated to become more robust.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Running time: From seconds to hours depending on the mesh size and number of species.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For example, on a 64 bit machine with Intel Core Duo T8300 and 3 GBytes of RAM, the provided test run requires less than 1 second.
Titulo: An open-source library for the numerical modeling of mass-transfer in solid oxide fuel cells
